title: 111_s3810
content: The Act may be cited as the "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" and includes a restriction on participation in offshore oil and gas leasing. The "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" mandates that leases for drilling on the Outer Continental Shelf require annual certification from lessees to confirm compliance with Iran sanctions, with lease cancellation as a consequence of non-compliance. The "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" requires annual certification from lessees for drilling on the Outer Continental Shelf to confirm compliance with Iran sanctions. Failure to make a certification or providing false information will result in lease cancellation by the Secretary of the Interior. The "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" mandates lessees on the Outer Continental Shelf to disclose any involvement in energy-related ventures outside Iran with individuals blocked under Executive Order 13224. The "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" requires lessees on the Outer Continental Shelf to disclose any ties to individuals blocked under Executive Order 13224, Executive Order 13382, or entities listed on appendix A to part 560 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. The Secretary is authorized to cancel the lease if necessary. The "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" authorizes the Secretary to cancel a lease if the person fails to disclose ties to blocked individuals or entities. The Secretary, in consultation with other departments, will cancel the lease if false disclosures are made. The Secretary of the Interior may waive the disclosure requirement on a case-by-case basis. The Secretary of the Interior can cancel a lease if false disclosures are made regarding ties to blocked individuals or entities. Waivers for the disclosure requirement can be granted on a case-by-case basis if it is in the national interest. The Secretary must report any lease cancellations promptly to the appropriate congressional committees. The Act will end 30 days after the President certifies to Congress that Iran has permanently stopped supporting international terrorism and no longer meets the criteria for being a state sponsor of terrorism.
